title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 25 november [1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 25 November [1868]
text: Brooklyn 25 Nov '68Novem 25My dear Walteri received your letter to day wensdayWednesday and the one on saturdaySaturday also and was particularly glad to get the letter and the contents as i was very short offof funds and as georgeyGeorgey had let mattyMatty have considerable before Jeffy came he wasentwasn't very flush but the 2 dollars helped me out on saturdaySaturday and saturdaySaturday night georgeGeorge gave me some so you see providence has provided) Jeffy is here came last fridayFriday mattyMatty is better i think she went to new yorkNew York yesterday and is quite smart much better than she was a few weeks ago Jeff and she talks of coming to washingtonWashington for a few days the first of next week Jeff will write to inform you what day they will come) i have had several letters from heydeHeyde saying hannaHannah is gaining but her arm by his account seemesseems to be bad yet) have you wrote to Doctor theirThayer yet walterWalter if you receive a letter from him i wish you would send it to me) hellen priceHelen Price was here yesterday to dinner she says they think so strangestrange you haventhaven't wrote to them mrsMrs. price aintain't very well but so she sshe's around mrMr. Davis from providence has been to see them hellenHelen said he said your next vacation he hoped you would spent at his houshouse georgeGeorge has not commenced his house yet but is talking about it) i am pretty smart mattyMatty wontwon't bring either of the pets good bie walterWalter deari write in a hurry as usual Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 25 November [1868]
